website_summaries.verdict: A comfortable and affordable backless chair with wheels for mobility.
pros: A comfortable chair with one of Gaiam's durable exercise balls
Customers love the immediate relief this chair provides
Includes a 52 cm exercise ball and pump
cons: Some customers found the leg extenders necessary to add height and comfort

customer_reviews.title: Product broke in 1.5 months.
customer_reviews.text: This Gaiam backless ball chair broke in 1.5 months from purchase. 1. The chrome bar, which holds the ball on the base, sheared off at the threads that screw into the plastic. (See product images of chrome bars holding bar.) 2. I do not exceed the height or weight capacity. (M, 5' 10'' 168#) 3. The other bar is showing signs of torquing/bending as well. I still use the ball but have to be extra careful not to roll off the base when I move around my desk. In hindsight, I should have purchased the other model with a back. It looks sturdier. See the attached photos showing the broken vs. normal threads.
customer_reviews.author: John S.

customer_reviews.title: Kid-sized ball received.
customer_reviews.text: I have to assume I was sent the kids sized ball with the backless chair. The ball is tiny, doesn't fit securely in the chair and is inches smaller than the other Gaiam balls we have in the office. The blue ball is the new one just received. I will see if I can get a replacement ball or will be returning the chair/ball set.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Rottinger

customer_reviews.title: LOVE
customer_reviews.text: Love it...super comfortable and squishy...I bought height extenders to make it higher but honestly I didn't need to...It was a good height without them as well..I'am 5ft 2" I added the extenders and then let a little of the air out of the ball.If you ever need new casters/wheels you can get them from the company website or from Amazon..they are 1 Centimeter in Diameter. The chair is sturdy..a hard plastic like "Little Tykes Toys" the metal stablity bar is on the front AND back..it screws in, top and bottom..the casters snap in I hope it doesn't break like the other reviewers said theirs did!
customer_reviews.author: sewbiz

customer_reviews.title: I love my new chair!
customer_reviews.text: I love my new chair! I have used the one with the back on it before but found that I prefer a backless chair instead. It was a little tough getting the wires to insert correctly in the holes provided so that I could secure the other hardware but with a little effort I was able to get it put together in about 30 minutes. The reason I am giving it four stars instead of five is because I received the child sized ball instead of the 52cm ball that was supposed to be packaged with the chair. However, I contacted Amazon customer service and they were able to assist in getting the issue resolved quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Kristie LeMoine

customer_reviews.title: Solution found!
customer_reviews.text: With the current COVID situation of working at home I needed to find myself a new office chair that I could handle 40+ hours a week, my back was aching after week one. This was the perfect solution. My back felt better within 2 days. Economically, it was a great buy. Have recommended it to several of my coworkers and friends. Only complaint - I hated the wheels. They were very rough on my hardwood floor and they get locked up easy if you bump them. I did order rubber replacement wheels from a different vendor and love them on the chair.
customer_reviews.author: Nikki Statler

customer_reviews.title: Metal brackets break... Quick. Surround the floor with pillows.
customer_reviews.text: 2 months after purchase both the metal support rods broke (about a week apart). E-mailed customer service. She replied "need order#". I sent it. "The parts are back ordered" two weeks later "The parts are back ordered" 1 month later "the parts are back ordered" . Summary... Cheap Chinese product (which we've all come to expect and accept). No customer support ( which we've all come to expect and accept). I know this review will accomplish nothing except 2 minutes of my time to vent. Hmmm... I do feel a little better. Lol
customer_reviews.author: Starchild

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to assemble
customer_reviews.text: I am sitting on the chair as I write this. Don't understand all the complaints. Very easy to assemble. Pop the wheels in and place the inflated ball on the cradle. Don't bother with the metal bars. Not needed. Yes, you have to re-inflate the ball. Read the instructions. Just got it but very comfortable and surprisingly stable. I am 5'6" and it is perfect for my desk which is 29" from floor. No wheel extensions necessary.
customer_reviews.author: smokeyblu

customer_reviews.title: GREAT Chair and Exercise Tool!
customer_reviews.text: I have 3 of these in my home, one on each floor (2 were ordered recently, 1 I've have for a few years). I LOVE these because as a chair, they force me to sit using good posture with back straight, and they are height "adjustable" based on how much air you put in them. I have 3 because I replaced old hard uncomfortable chairs with these; these are MUCH easier on the tailbone! They work great as an exercise tool. They are made from a thick rubber-ish material (durable), and they come with a hand pump which is fairly easy to use even when they are entirely deflated. The plug is leak-free. I would buy this product again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awful Customer Service, Poor Quality Product
customer_reviews.text: The ball does not in any way expand to fit the chair. I complained to Gaiam support and they told me I was incorrect in claiming it was the wrong sized ball that I received, and that I needed to keep deflating and inflating. This is all I get after 5 days and 8 inflations. Instant return! Customer service did nothing. Jennifer Worner is the worst!
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly

customer_reviews.title: Good concept, Poor Quality
customer_reviews.text: As a chair this is pretty awesome. It's the right height and reasonably easy to wheel around. It's short, and fits under my desk when its in the standing position without getting in my way. I gave it a low review because, after a few months of use, one of my metal brackets broke. I plan on investigating a way to fix the bracket because I really like the rest of the chair. Judging by the other reviews I don't believe that I will get appropriate support for this issue, and I plan on simply fixing it myself instead.
customer_reviews.author: Katelyn Standiford

customer_reviews.title: Just perfect
customer_reviews.text: I needed a new chair for my tiny office space when I was forced to teach from home. This was perfect. After reading reviews, when I got it, I didn't use the metal bars that came with it. No need for them. I also liked how my other yoga balls fit in it as well. I will be ordering one for my classroom too! Much more comfortable that a regular office chair, and I can do lunch time yoga!
customer_reviews.author: shanmarryan

customer_reviews.title: No pressure points to aggravate sciatica/piriformis syndrome
customer_reviews.text: I decided on this chair for several reasons: the obvious health benefits; I have a hard time sitting still even when I'm working (I routinely bounce while I'm typing so I get a fidgety workout even while I study); and I needed something that fit completely under my desk since it shares space with my exercise studio. I love it! It's easy to assemble, it's the most comfortable chair I've ever used, and it doesn't cause any pressure points that aggravate my sciatica or piriformis syndrome! I'm only 5'2", but my 6'3" partner sat on it last week and even HE thought it was the most comfortable chair he'd ever tried.
customer_reviews.author: Tara

customer_reviews.title: Nice chair, good for posture
customer_reviews.text: I needed a new chair for my home office due to working from home all the time, so I was looking for something that would help with posture and wasn’t too expensive - this chair fit these criteria. It was easy to assemble, it only took me 15 minutes; and it performs exactly as described - my back feels better! It doesn’t roll particularly well but for $50+ that’s no big deal to me. Just note that this chair isn’t adjustable so it wouldn’t work for tall people; I’m 5’6” and it’s just right, but if you are much taller, it won’t work so well.
customer_reviews.author: Dana C

customer_reviews.title: Great Chair but One Pet Peeve...
customer_reviews.text: I use this chair for work and I love that it has wheels and no back. I tend to rely on the back and arm rests of most chairs more often than I should so this chair is perfect for me. The only problem I have is I constantly turn the wheels "off" to where they won't roll. It gets really annoying and the clasps snap really loud (which sometimes comes as an unexpected shock). Otherwise its a great chair!
customer_reviews.author: Larissa G.

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy
customer_reviews.text: I'm so bugged by this purchase. I had bought one of these a while ago and needed another so I found this one. I just set it up and they sent me a baby ball. It literally doesn't even fit in the base even when it's all the way pumped up. Don't waste your time or your money. I attached a photo of the new one compared to my old one to show the size difference and I also attached a picture of the gap the ball has. If I sit on it the ball falls through 😡
customer_reviews.author: Jag

customer_reviews.title: The Ball is Tiny
customer_reviews.text: And YES we followed directions in waiting 24 hours to put more air in it ... for a week! And when the ball is pumped up it is stiff.
customer_reviews.author: Julie K.

customer_reviews.title: Great idea but poor quality
customer_reviews.text: One of the metal bars was defective so I never used it. At 5'7, I needed the extra lift for the wheels purchased separately. This made the height perfect but the chair does not roll well with them on. It could be the thin carpet at the office but it got much worse after putting on the extenders. Would suggest either going with a better chair or just using a good balance ball for less money and greater durability.
customer_reviews.author: Frankie's mum

customer_reviews.title: You have to "over inflate" the ball!
customer_reviews.text: I almost sent this back because apparently I initially didn't fill the ball with enough air, so it looked like a lot of the others in the comments (way too small for the base.) However, I ran across a comment in the ball replacement page and they said it is the right size, you just have to "over inflate" the ball. I decided to put some more air into it and it does indeed fit the base now! It's just as comfortable as my traditional office chair, but way more functional / easy to move around (I sit at an L-shaped desk all day, and this style is super amazing compared to other chairs I've used!)
customer_reviews.author: Lizzie

customer_reviews.title: Makes sitting an activity!
customer_reviews.text: Finally found a way to work with less work. Never been able to sit still and this chair lets me bounce, balance, roll, twitch, and turn to my butt's content. Improves my posture and is working on getting out the kinks in my back. I worried about fit after reading other reviews, but this is perfect height for my average frame at an average desk. Assembly was simple, the ball inflates and holds in air, and price was less than any other balance chair I looked at (you don't need a back- no one I know ever uses it). Plus with the wheels I can scoot around my three computer stations. Like riding a horse.
customer_reviews.author: Phelix

customer_reviews.title: size of ball
customer_reviews.text: I received this product and have inflated the ball to the firmest capacity however this ball does not fit the chair it is as if it is a 45 cm ball, It also does not touch the frame. I have a coworker who bought the same product except different color and hers fits the frame as does a 55 cm ball that i previously had. Will give it a few more days, but will probaly return as it does not raise me up to fit my desk.
customer_reviews.author: Mary

customer_reviews.title: Purple and round
customer_reviews.text: I eventually gave up on this. I got no positive exercise from using it, and over an hour or so I would end up with a back ache. So I pushed it to the curb and someone else is no doubt trying to appreciate it. I weigh about 130 lbs and had to add air once in awhile. When my spouse or son sat on it (250+ lbs) I had to turn the ball so that the metal bar at the base would cover the inflation hole. And still, keep that air pump handy.
customer_reviews.author: corgi lover

customer_reviews.title: If you ever change the design I would truly love a replacement set
customer_reviews.text: I am enjoying everything about the chair except for the design of the wheels. The locking mechanism should be similar to strollers; locked when the 'tabs' are pulled out and unlocked when they are flush/pressed down. Instead these wheels require the 'tab' be pulled (sticking out) in order for it to roll freely in an unlocked position. Your heels will constantly bump the sides of the casters and inadvertently lock the wheels. Very frustrating. If you ever change the design I would truly love a replacement set!!!!!! I am constantly having to bend over and unlock my chair in order to easily move around my desk area.
customer_reviews.author: BJStewart

customer_reviews.title: Fully inflated 22 3/4 inches. NOT 24 inches tall
customer_reviews.text: My lady inflated this and we assumed it was the wrong ball. So I gave it a shot and inflated it a ton more. It fits as you can see in the photos but it is still over an inch below their advertised price. The ball is very firm at its max. Not a huge deal for us but could be for others. Writing this review the first day. So hopefully it doesn’t pop as other customers have. :( All in all it seems pretty good if they send you the correct size ball.
customer_reviews.author: Buy now, single later.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent chair to promote core muscles and posture
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this chair for my wife due to her having neck and back pain from working at her desk most of the day. The chair is easy to assemble (took me less than 10 minutes) and is very sturdy. As far as function goes, she says she really likes it because it forces you to use your core muscles to support yourself. It has become her favorite chair now for her use at work. This appears to be a great product.
customer_reviews.author: t-man

customer_reviews.title: Missing plug and wrong size ball
customer_reviews.text: Ball won’t inflate past 41 inches and it’s missing a plug to keep air in. Very excited to take to work and use tomorrow since I just received for my birthday today! BUT that’s not happening bc I have to send the whole thing back and purchase from another brand since this seems to be a reoccurring problem for this company. Sending a child size ball and missing plug.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Within 3 months the ball had punctured and is useless. I sent an email to customer service asking ...
customer_reviews.text: Within a month the bar that holds the ball in place snapped. Within 3 months the ball had punctured and is useless. I sent an email to customer service asking if they would address the issue but received no response. The product itself worked well, it seems like the quality is the issue. If I receive a response I will re-post otherwise you should consider another vendor for an otherwise good idea.
customer_reviews.author: WeeCat

customer_reviews.title: My back already feels better!
customer_reviews.text: My posture has definitely improved by using this chair! I sit on my computer for hours at a time sometimes & my neck and back would KILL me when I finally got up, but I can tell just by using this chair for five days, my back hurts less and I actually am forced to sit up straight when I'm on it, so overall I think my posture has gotten better! Despite having feels, it does not move around and slide everywhere every time you slightly move like some annoying office chairs! I reccomend this ball chair for anyone sitting for long hours, it really does help.
customer_reviews.author: Erika GustafsonTop Contributor: Makeup

customer_reviews.title: A good buy
customer_reviews.text: Read a lot of reviews and decided on this chair. I avoided getting one with a back because reviewers were stating that it made them slouch or hurt their lower back. I have only had it a few days, but so far so good. It is my new chair at work. It arrived in the afternoon, so by the time I got around to assembling it (easy to do) I only used it for about 45 min, but I could feel it in my core (abs) after I went home. I think with continual use, I will strengthen my core and improve my posture.
customer_reviews.author: NettyC

customer_reviews.title: Don't regret buying.
customer_reviews.text: Works as described. Good quality. No problems really. Butt does get a bit warm after a while though (more than a chair, due to the ball) but then hey just take a break (you deserve it!)
customer_reviews.author: Andrew78

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE my ball chair! I was nervous about purchasing it because I didn't know how comfortable it would be to sit on for 8 hrs. I am SO glad I bought it! It took a couple of days to get my "bum" used to sitting on a ball. (Don't over inflate because it makes it too hard!) But now I don't want to sit on anything else. It has helped my posture overall--when sitting and standing.
customer_reviews.author: Mel

customer_reviews.title: Good but the wheel locks are annoying
customer_reviews.text: Been using it for a while and it works well. My complaint is that two of the swivel wheels have locking casters. Normally that's not a big deal but on this chair due to the fact that it's a ball chair my heels accidentally hit those little locks all the time. Then when I go to roll out from the desk the brakes make it hard and there's a loud clicking/grinding. I get that some people would want these locks but for me they're just a pain.
customer_reviews.author: Dwayne M. Parkinson

customer_reviews.title: ball difficult to inflate
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE: Customer service contacted me directly with additional information and instructions - saying that the ball would stretch, I just need to inflate/deflate/inflate to get it to the right size. I tried that method several times and eventually had to use an electric air compressor to get it to the proper size. There is no way that the pump included with purchase was going to complete the job. ORIGINAL REVIEW: The ball is about 1/2 the size listed in product description. I have contacted support and hope to receive a replacement in the correct size. I will update this review if that happens and I am actually able to use the chair!
customer_reviews.author: A. M. O'Connell

customer_reviews.title: Awesome little chair
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing at my office desk. I can do some crunches when I start feeling lazy and it doesn't make any noise which might weird out my coworkers. The base works well, other than the wheel locks that I accidentally step on about 5 times a day. Overall, I'm really happy I purchased this!
customer_reviews.author: Kels

customer_reviews.title: A paint o assemble but very comfortable.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased two of these. One a few weeks back for the office. That one was perfect. Easy to assemble and works fine. The second one was almost impossible to assemble with the two side bars shaped to NOT fit in the holes. While only off by a little bit, I was impossible to assemble the chair on my own. My husband had to help and we needed to bend the metal bars to make it fit. To fill the ball with air with the little hand pump provided would probably take forever and could be considered a serious workout ;-) Once the ball chair has been assembled it is very comfortable though!
customer_reviews.author: AmazonCustomer

customer_reviews.title: Love this! Remote work savior!
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical when I opened the package for this. It seemed cheap and too small. After assembling it I still thought it may be too small but then I sat at my desk and started working and it is perfect! It isn't cheap feeling at all. It is sturdy and the perfect height for me. I am so happy. I am not tall though (I'm 5'3") so maybe if you are bigger than me this may not be an adequate size? I think the height is perfect though and my back and posture feel so much better already! And you can replace the ball with a bigger ball if you need to!
customer_reviews.author: Leah Sanfillipo

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product
customer_reviews.text: I got this ball chair at the recommendation of my acupuncturist and my chiropractor who have been treating me for over a year for lower back pain. It does seem to help me sit straighter while I'm working at my computer and the fact that I have to more or less constantly adjust my posture and back for balance will, I hope, improve my back muscle tone and strength in time.
customer_reviews.author: jenjan

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed in quality.
customer_reviews.text: Heard ball "pop" last night after 3 months of light use. BTW, I was not sitting on it. It then deflated and will not hold reinflate. I can not hear a leak or see a seam break. I fall well within height and weight allowance. Don't waste your money. It only comes with a 30day warrenty.
customer_reviews.author: Julianne Fiore

customer_reviews.title: Give it a few days to stretch out
customer_reviews.text: Like many others reviewing this chair I first thought the ball was WAY too small and almost returned it. But the instructions said I may need to blow it up a few times over the first couple days. So I did, and sure enough the rubber on the ball expanded and the ball is now the correct size. I fit at my standard size desk quite well. For reference I am 5'4" and am able sit comfortably with my legs at 90 degrees. So for anyone thinking of returning because the ball is too small, I say give it a few days! I highly recommend this chair!
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca S

customer_reviews.title: Great chair at a fair price
customer_reviews.text: Cost, small foot print, fits my existing exercise ball (so I have a back up), simple design (no back). Much better then cashing the ball around my office which I have been doing for years since I got rid of the awkward office chairs. Good posture control when stabilized so it keeps back in position.
customer_reviews.author: Bobby Lee

customer_reviews.title: The platform is sturdy and appears as designed
customer_reviews.text: The platform is sturdy and appears as designed. I've only had it for 4 days and I've already had to air it up twice so I think it might have a small leak in the ball. Also, the color is pretty off as compared to what is shown. The wheels don't work to well either. I do like the concept and how I sit on it when the ball is full aired up. It was very simple to put together.
customer_reviews.author: STAHDN

customer_reviews.title: Great Purchase !!!
customer_reviews.text: This chair is so sick. Easy to build. Really good height, at least for me (5’8”). The wheels don’t work great, but the chair still gets around fine and it doesn’t scratch my floor and it’s a YOGA BALL DESK CHAIR. Did not disappoint at all. You can also use the yoga ball separately btw just in case anyone was wondering.
customer_reviews.author: Angela

customer_reviews.title: I'm not happy! the metal parts do not screw all the ...
customer_reviews.text: so far, I'm not happy! the metal parts do not screw all the way in. The ball is nowhere near 20 inches. There's no plug for the ball so all the air deflated out as soon as I took my finger off the ball. one of the nuts is missing. i love the idea of this, but it wasn't what i ordered.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Rough start, but not a bad intro to ball sitting
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE 3/28: An email to customer service and a plug is on its way (my spare not a perfect fit) AND once the ball stretches, you can add more air which increased the size to more like I expected. I'm happier. Upping rating. UPDATE 3/26: found a spare plug and inflated. It seems too small. Will try more air in 24 hours. One star due to missing plug (making it absolutely unusable and purposeless) and the brackets do not insert into holes very easily AT ALL. Very disappointed but will update rating if I can get the parts I need and put together to use.
customer_reviews.author: B. R. Hollowell

customer_reviews.title: Pretty Ball Chair
customer_reviews.text: Like other reviews, I received the wrong colored ball. That was frustrating, but the exchange was simple. They did not charge to exchange, either. They delivered the correct ball immediately after so there wasn't much hassle. Chair in Ocean color looks exactly like the photo displayed.
customer_reviews.author: Ash G

customer_reviews.title: Worked great until it popped.
customer_reviews.text: Was a great chair with my only complaint being the wheel locks would randomly lock. But this morning I was sitting on the chair and the seam on the ball split open and started deflating. I've used it in my office as a normal chair for about 6 months and my previous exercise ball lasted 3 years and was still in great condition. Will probably purchase a regular exercise ball instead of wasting the extra money on this uneccessary plastic chair part next time. It worked great until it didn't. Sigh.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan Threlkeld

customer_reviews.title: skeptical at first...
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the blue one and i was disappointed how low it was on initial inflation of the ball. I have tendentious in my knees so I have to be careful how I sit in chairs or I am in overwhelming pain by Friday. I used it for a few days and got used to inflating it every morning. I am on day 4 and its to a normal chair height and i can actually use it for 10+ hours a day pretty easily; just be patient with re-inflating it for a few days.
customer_reviews.author: cookiedough

customer_reviews.title: Engages muscles but makes my back sore
customer_reviews.text: I know my abdominal and back muscles are not very strong. I like this ball because it forces me to sit up. Since my muscles are weak, they get tired after an hour or two of sitting if I try to sit up perfectly straight. I don't think it's meant to make you sit up perfectly straight, but more so to engage your body while you sit. I really like this and I've recommended it to people. Just keep in mind that your body will have to get used to a new sitting style!
customer_reviews.author: Lily Clarkson

customer_reviews.title: Love ball chairs
customer_reviews.text: I have been using a ball chair now for 6-8 years easily. I just purchased this one when I started to commute from home due to the pandemic. My last one had a back on it, this does not... and I think it is better than the one I have at work that has a back. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: rdm76

customer_reviews.title: The ball is pretty small, like many other reviewers said
customer_reviews.text: The ball is pretty small, like many other reviewers said. I'm 5'3" and my legs are at a 90 degree angle sitting on it if it's inflated well. You do have to repump to top off the air about every 2 weeks (depending on how often you use it). The brakes on the wheels are very sensitive and lock with the slightest bump against something. I don't use the things that hold the ball on and have no issues with the ball being unstable. Overall, it's a decent chair, but if you're much taller than me I'd try to find the base separately and opt for a bigger ball.
customer_reviews.author: Jeseti

customer_reviews.title: Love this item!
customer_reviews.text: I had a chair similar to this at my job but it had a back on it that I felt was kind of pointless. You don’t actually sit that far back on the ball to use the little back support so I decided to get this one with no back. The ball does appear much smaller than pictured once you assemble it and follow the filling instructions, but when you sit on it and you’re at a table or desk it’s the perfect height. I also use this when I’m folding laundry and it works great!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I THOUGHT The ball was to small (child-size) - IT IS NOT
customer_reviews.text: Originally I thought I had received the wrong ball. I had inflated it and it APPEARED to be full at only about 15-16 inches. I called the customer service number and they let me know that they had INCREASED THE QUALITY of the materials and it WILL expand to the 22 inches. I did what they said and it HAS inflated to the proper size. I took one star off because the company should have explained that somewhere better. So many reviews are stating this problem. BUT... The C.S. did respond promptly and accuratey.
customer_reviews.author: Karen

customer_reviews.title: I love this chair so much that I gave it to ...
customer_reviews.text: I got this chair to use at work. I love this chair so much that I gave it to my friends as present and bought another one for myself. The only problem I have is that it is so easy to lower the anti-movement lock located in the base by my feet without intention. It should be more difficult.
customer_reviews.author: Sooyoung Chung

customer_reviews.title: Super easy to use and setup
customer_reviews.text: Love this product! Offers great stability. I've used it for months now, maybe better half of the year. Word of caution though, get ready for core strengthening just from sitting on it! For me, I was out of breath the first few days and had to ease into it, but after a few weeks later felt a noticeable difference in my core strengthening. I read another review, that said, the metal holder is not necessary. Totally agree, the ball sits well on the roller by itself. Overall, great product. Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: S

customer_reviews.title: Way too small
customer_reviews.text: The ball is super small. Doesn’t even hit the metal pieces as shown. I feel like I’m sitting so low to the ground when I’m at my desk. Something doesn’t seem right. It’s nothing like the photo. :(
customer_reviews.author: Jacelyn Jaeger

customer_reviews.title: Wheel brakes are inconvenient. :(
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble. The con is that the little black switch for wheel brakes are inconvenient. My feet accidentally bump them regularly, causing the wheels to drag and scrape our floors. Ball is bouncy. Forces core work. Can I get a pair of regular wheels to replace these?
customer_reviews.author: B&N

customer_reviews.title: This is the hardest ball chair I have ever put ...
customer_reviews.text: This is the hardest ball chair I have ever put together. The bars that connect to the base to hold the ball in place DO NOT go into the holes at all. After hitting them with a hammer etc. to try and get the the ends through the holes, I had to actually bend the bars to make it work. The bars are now scratched, dented etc because of how I had to insert them. I can't even return it because of the damage I did to try and assemble the base. Don't buy this.
customer_reviews.author: Wendy P.

customer_reviews.title: metal piece broke off before a year of having it
customer_reviews.text: I bought this in 2016 of October and today is August 2, 2017. The metal piece snapped right off on the one side and the other side is already getting worn. Well I didn't think it was a big deal I was missing one metal piece until I leaned over and the ball came right off the roller and I fell and landed hard on my butt and now my lower back hurts. I want to contact the seller and can't find out how. Shouldn't there be a warranty on these?
customer_reviews.author: Christina

customer_reviews.title: ... in my classroom for alternative seating and the students love it. The bolts do not stay secured on ...
customer_reviews.text: I use this in my classroom for alternative seating and the students love it. The bolts do not stay secured on the sides which has been frustrating. The bars seem to stay in place without the bolts though so we have been using them that way. I have not had to re-inflate the balls once since setting up. Impressed with the product.
customer_reviews.author: Charlotte Locke

customer_reviews.title: Seriously!!
customer_reviews.text: The ball seems full at 16-17" and doesn't even fill up the chair. I feel like I bought seconds as their was a piece of tape next to a ding in the ball. I've filled it up anyway but it's a far cry from even fitting the chairs frame! Seriously what am I suppose to do with this!
customer_reviews.author: Annie

customer_reviews.title: What you see is not what you get
customer_reviews.text: Total scam. The description clearly states that this comes with a 52 cm ball, but they save a few bucks by sending you a 40 cm one. The whole apparatus is about 17.5 inches tall, which simply doesn’t work as an office chair. I can’t believe this company hasn’t been shut down. I guess yoga types are willing to put up with a lot of crap.
customer_reviews.author: R-Kell

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Since I have a full time desk job I like that I no longer have arm rests to rest my arms and lean during the day, forcing me to sit up straight, with my feet flat on the floor. Since I'm short my legs typically dangle causing leg cramps. Healthy choice with this chair!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: this is a child sized stability ball at best and is not even close to being desk height
customer_reviews.text: The ball was incredibly small. I actually gave it to a friend who is a grade school teacher for use in her classroom. No matter what the description says, this is a child sized stability ball at best and is not even close to being desk height. I am 5' 9", but even my 5'2" secretary said it was too short for her to use as a desk chair. I bought a regular 65 cm ball and swapped them out. The larger ball works fine as a desk chair.
customer_reviews.author: angrywench1965

customer_reviews.title: The ball is much smaller than I thought
customer_reviews.text: I expect the ball to be much larger but I pump it to fit the base and it feels like a toy for my kid. I wish the ball seat is as large as the gym yoga ball. Otherwise, it's easy to assemble and it feels quite bouncy and so far serves as an alternative seat when WFH.
customer_reviews.author: gigi

customer_reviews.title: Great chair.
customer_reviews.text: I love this chair. It works perfect for me. I've had it a few weeks now and the only drawback is see is that it needs a cover. If you don't' wear a fabric that is thick like jeans it will make your booty sweat. The wheels are a little cheap so they don't really roll very smoothly but for a safety standpoint that is probably a good thing. I give the company that sent it to me a 2. it arrived quickly but they never answered my request for a plug for the ball. it didn't arrive with one and i had to find one elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia Overn

customer_reviews.title: Got the right size ball!
customer_reviews.text: I haven’t had the chair long but wanted to chime in regarding the size of the ball. I read the reviews and was nervous to order due to the number of comments discussing the ball being undersized. I decided to take my chances and was pleasantly surprised to find that I received the correct ball. So, for anyone reading these comments finding themselves worried about getting the proper size ball with their order, rest assured. As long as you follow the directions and give the ball time to stretch to the ultimate size, you will not be disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Howell

customer_reviews.title: Easy and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Love this ball chair. It was easy to assemble. This chair is a great option if you have circulation issues. Other chairs tend to make my feet swell. Not this ball chair. The only thing that I don’t like about it is the break levers. It’s too easy to accidentally push them down with your feet.
customer_reviews.author: Tammy Cleveringa

customer_reviews.title: Much Smaller than the Original Version
customer_reviews.text: I needed a second one because the frame on my first one broke after a year. I was SORELY disappointed with the new ball that came. It's not even close to the original in size or material. Needless to say I feel like I am sitting on the floor it's so low. Gaiam, you need to take these reviews to heart. This new product you are passing off as the original (including in the photos) is subpar and you should do better.
customer_reviews.author: Diana

customer_reviews.title: Broke after about 6 months of regular use
customer_reviews.text: I was loving this product until today. I sat down and one of the bolts for the support pieces sheared in half. I am well under the weight restrictions and use it as my daily office chair so this isn't a matter of improper use. Clearly they used a poor grade of material for their bolts or need to have a talk with their supplier. It looks like I will have to go back to my old, traditional office chair.
customer_reviews.author: amanda babic

customer_reviews.title: Fun chair, but brakes keep activating on their own
customer_reviews.text: This is great for my office. I've had to refill it a few times, but other than that it's kept it's shape. At first I was very concerned it wasn't big enough, but I just kept pumping until it was big enough. My complaint is that the brakes turn on all the time. They make a super loud noise when I move with the brakes down. I'm currently experimenting with options to remove the brakes.
customer_reviews.author: Katie Haas

customer_reviews.title: Not what I expected
customer_reviews.text: I bought the original chair with a back. I wanted a replacement cause I liked it so much. If you look at the description, they should be the same. As you can see in my pic, this is what I got.
customer_reviews.author: Kubsrn

customer_reviews.title: Caution, Bride of Chucky yoga ball!
customer_reviews.text: Well.....they got me with the child ball too. The base is great though. I would buy it again if the ball that comes with the chair fits in the base. Or if the ball is anything like the pictures in the description. The only reason they didnt get 1 star is because Amazon made it right. Thank you Amazon!
customer_reviews.author: El-donkodelpuncherello

customer_reviews.title: Enclosed Gaiam ball was too small.
customer_reviews.text: The enclosed ball was too small. Not only did it not inflate to the size it was supposed to (52cm), it was too small to work at my desk. That was with leg extenders (bought separately) on the chair. Leg extenders on the chair make the chair sit 2" higher. I returned the chair and ball, thinking the wrong ball had been sent. I received a replacement with the same size ball. I decided to cut my losses, keep the chair, and order a bigger ball from a different company. The pink ball you see is a 55cm and is much better. Again, this is with 2" leg extenders on the chair.
customer_reviews.author: eydie falkenhagen

customer_reviews.title: The ball and chair base are both very sturdy, I don't even use the two metal rods ...
customer_reviews.text: This chair has changed my work life. The ball and chair base are both very sturdy, I don't even use the two metal rods that came with it to hold the ball in place, I don't really have an issue with the ball moving around. I definitely never realized just how stiff my back was from sitting at a desk until I got this chair. My back has so much more flexibility now! I am 5'5 and the chair is the perfect height for me at my desk.2
customer_reviews.author: KisforKismet

customer_reviews.title: The best paint reliever ever- it works!
customer_reviews.text: The best paint reliever ever for a tailbone. I use one Gaiam ball chair in office and purchased one to use at home. Very long lasting product , proven concept, good value for money, stable, and it works !!! I love it .
customer_reviews.author: Jelena

customer_reviews.title: Much higher than I anticipated.
customer_reviews.text: This chair sits several inches higher than I anticipated, so it's not very comfortable. I have to straddle the ball completely to stay on top of it, otherwise I slide off the front. I tried taking the wheels off, but that wasn't a solution either. However, removing the ball to use as an exercise prop is easy,
customer_reviews.author: Lauren M. Jenkins

customer_reviews.title: Great seats.
customer_reviews.text: I bought two. One is perfect, but the other one keeps getting flat even when no one uses it. I contacted the company directly just like amazon suggested and they replaced it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Beware- the ball included in the box is NOT 52 cm
customer_reviews.text: Beware- the ball included is far too small for the base or any adult that's not a hobbit. It is NOT 52 cm in diameter as stated. Mine measured only about 40 cm. Pictures are false advertisement. You will need to purchase a larger ball for certain. The base is easy to assemble but doesn't appear to be high quality. I am hoping it will support my 134 lbs.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. Mia Wallace

customer_reviews.title: Omg I am so happy I bought this
customer_reviews.text: This chair is a lifesaver. It’s high quality and it’s perfect desk height so I’m glad I didn’t buy the feet extenders for it. It helps me with my posture and after two days using it my back pain has decreased! Thank u!
customer_reviews.author: happy

customer_reviews.title: Used product🤔should be NEW
customer_reviews.text: My product was suppose to be new;however, I'm unsure due to the label on my ball is fading away. See pictures My ball does not appear to be as full as my friends balls. They have the chairs, also. I was so looking forward to this ball chair. So disappointed😳
customer_reviews.author: Heavy Favor

customer_reviews.title: Great desk chair
customer_reviews.text: Love this chair, it is my "teachers chair", my students are amazed by it, and ask to sit and try it out. I think my back hurts less because my poster is better without a back to slump into. Of course as a teacher, I don't spend tons of time at my desk, like some jobs would require.
customer_reviews.author: Cathy Davis

customer_reviews.title: Better for tall people
customer_reviews.text: I'm 5'1 and found the ball in the chair to be way too tall to sit at my desk (impossible to keep feet flat on the floor). The concept is nice though. I found the ball more comfortable without the 'chair' part, however, my ball stopped holding air (small hole - not even sure how that happened) less than a year.
customer_reviews.author: photochic

customer_reviews.title: Hardware does not fit, and ball is kid size
customer_reviews.text: The hardware does not fit through drilled holes leaving bars uneven. When I blew up the ball, it is kid size and doesn't even fill space where ball goes. I am not impressed at all. Hopefully I can buy a regular sized yoga ball and replace this one, and have someone drill out larger holes so the hardware can fit through.
customer_reviews.author: devon reynolds

customer_reviews.title: Wrong size ball
customer_reviews.text: The first one I ordered looked like it may have been a return. The ball was way too small and dropped right through the base to the floor not even touching the supports. So I return it for a replacement- same issue. There is clearly an issue with this production. Not happy and will my be wasting my time again.
customer_reviews.author: KM

customer_reviews.title: The ball is 25 inches! Waste of my time
customer_reviews.text: Hmmm so ordered this and it's supposed to be a ball sized for 5-5 feet 11 and the ball only inflates to 25 inches!! I inflated and waited the 24 hours and delayed 50% and did again and that's as big as it gets. Now I have to waste my time trying to return and start over.
customer_reviews.author: Erika B.

customer_reviews.title: A perfect alternative to traditional office chairs.
customer_reviews.text: I use these for my students in class. They are true wiggle worms. One ball did deflate, but I was able to reorder a new one. There are currently 15 of these chairs rolling around my classroom and I couldn't be happier with the positive effects it has on my students. They sit up straighter, can bounce a bit while listening, and are able to get the bugs out of their bottoms.
customer_reviews.author: HeatherK

customer_reviews.title: Great quality but still hurt my back
customer_reviews.text: Surprisingly this hurt my tailbone and still did not help my glute or low back issues. Actually made it worse. Great quality, just didn’t work for me.
customer_reviews.author: ok2shop

customer_reviews.title: Broke after 1.5 years of moderate use
customer_reviews.text: Loved it while it lasted, I had for 1.5 years. Only used it half of the work day if that. Today, the support bar broke and is not fixable. I feel like spending $50, I should of been able to get more use out of it.
customer_reviews.author: Lavier

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and Practical
customer_reviews.text: I use this in my sports massage practice. The comfort of a stability ball with the mobility of a stool. I had to knock a star because the brake levers are flimsy. Some well placed duct tape keeps them from locking the wheels unnecessarily.
customer_reviews.author: HardPressedLMT

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected!!
customer_reviews.text: Base is easy to put together. I've read other reviews that said the ball was too small, but if you use an air compressor to inflate the ball will come out a perfect size. In fact, after inflating my ball I had to let some air out because it was too stiff/tall. The hand pump will do just fine as well but it will take a lot longer and you will have some resistance when the ball begins to stretch. Overall a great product...just bought another one for my wife to use at her desk.
customer_reviews.author: Zack

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Ball pump didn’t work. Had to use own ball. Metal bracing doesn’t fit correctly. Wheel brakes constantly lock causing trouble. Would be great if worked correctly.
customer_reviews.author: GF

customer_reviews.title: Lasted about a week...
customer_reviews.text: This lasted for about a week. The ball popped when my child was using it. Ball was not overinflated and my child weighs less than 100 lbs. Unbelievable...
customer_reviews.author: AmazonDiva23

customer_reviews.title: sometimes the locking wheels lock on their own
customer_reviews.text: I use it as my work chair at my office. The only problem I have with it is that the 2 wheels that have locks sometimes lock on their own and the stand won't roll. Other than that - it is a great tool 4-18-19 I broke the lock tabs off the 2 locking wheels and it is great. You can still lock them but no more accidental locking. It's great
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Broken, heavily used and dirty
customer_reviews.text: The support bars that hold the ball in place were broken. Luckily it works okay enough without them but still, I wouldn't have bought it if I knew it would be as used and dirty as it was or that it would be broken. If the return process was easier and faster I'd return it. But, it's not worth paying 20 dollars for postage to return it just to get a 40 dollar refund, if it wasn't going to work at all I wouldn't be keeping it.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel A

customer_reviews.title: Good sub for Office Chair
customer_reviews.text: The metal piece broke easily from the anchor part. Cheaper than the earlier versions but i guess you get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Dmb41

customer_reviews.title: Brakes on the wheels lock constantly.  Otherwise a great chair.
customer_reviews.text: Wasn't as big as I expected, but it works well once I got it inflated correctly. My biggest complaint is that the brakes on the wheels engage way too easily. I have to move back and forth at my desk a lot and it's very annoying to have to constantly release the brakes on the wheels.
customer_reviews.author: TroubleEFG

customer_reviews.title: Was nice then boom
customer_reviews.text: Was a nice product until it suddenly exploded while I was teaching a class of students with reading difficulties. Now I'm stuck when a piece of plastic and wheels
customer_reviews.author: Olivia

customer_reviews.title: Ball popped while sitting on it-- OUCH.
customer_reviews.text: Base is great. The ball quality is not. The ball popped and dropped me painfully onto the base/floor after 8 months of use. Two stars for at least getting 8 months of use out of it? I'm an averaged-sized adult, using the ball chair at work. Also, as other people have noted, the stability bars sheered off at the nut after only a couple of months of use.
customer_reviews.author: Lera

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace an old office seat that was only okay and not helping my back at all. It was simple to assemble and well worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: Not sure if safe.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this on 10/30/17 and one of the bars that holds the ball in broke. I went to go sit on the ball, the ball rolled and everything flipped out from under me. I fell and now i am in a lot of pain.
customer_reviews.author: Becalynn

customer_reviews.title: Included Ball is too small
customer_reviews.text: The ball seems way too small for the chair. I used a bigger ball I happened to have already have. I’m 5’4” and I felt I was sitting too low. I put in a bigger ball and it’s perfect.
customer_reviews.author: opelch

product_meta.title: Gaiam Classic Backless Balance Ball Chair – Exercise Stability Yoga Ball Premium Ergonomic Chair for Home and Office Desk with Air Pump, Exercise Guide and Satisfaction Guarantee
product_meta.description:
This revolutionary desk chair will change the way you sit. Designed with a work-life balance in mind, the Backless Gaiam Balance Ball Chair provides all-day ergonomic support for a healthier back and stronger core. This exercise ball chair was created by Gaiam with the help of chiropractic pioneer Dr. Randy Weinzoft. This stability ball chair alleviates the aching arms, restless legs, and aching back pain that comes from sitting at a desk for hours by promoting micro movements and engaging your core throughout the day. Without a back rest, the backless balance ball chair encourages great posture while seated and leads to less back pain and a healthier spine. Feel better at your workplace by using this alternative chair that promotes wellness throughout the day. This unique office chair is designed for people between 5' - 5'11" for use at any standard desk. For users that may need an extra boost, the Gaiam Leg Extenders add 2 inches in height to the chair. Please note that for the ball to fit perfectly in the base, it may be necessary to re-inflate the ball once or twice after initial inflation. 

Includes:
- 1 Classic yoga ball that can be taken out of the chair base and used separately for exercises. 
- 4 Easy-glide caster wheels (2 lockable) 
- 1 Adjustable metal support bar 
- 1 Air pump 
- 1 Desk chair exercise guide for activating your sit in the home or office 

Gaiam is a leading lifestyle brand with a mission to make yoga, fitness, and well-being accessible to all. Gaiam was created as a lifestyle company with the vision that, given a choice, people would choose a lifestyle that is healthy and life enhancing, for themselves, their families and the Earth. The Gaiam wellness, yoga, meditation, and recovery lifestyle is a vote for individual health as well as the future sustainability of the Earth's resources. Gaiam strives to provide customers with alternatives to traditional products by offering natural or healthy versions that compare with the style, quality and price of conventional products.
feature_bullets: INCLUDES: Removable 52-centimeter (Diameter) blue exercise ball, an air pump, an adjustable metal support bar, 4 easy-glide casters (2 back wheels lockable), and a desktop exercise guide to stay active

BOOST ENERGY LEVELS: Using the same ball as the exercise guide, this chair helps to build a healthier core, align the spine, relieve back pain and stiffness, boost energy levels and increase productivity with an active body and a focused and engaged mind

RECOMMENDED USER HEIGHT: Designed for users 5' to 5'11" tall and fits most standard-height desks. For a taller chair, add 2 inches with Gaiam's compatible leg extenders, sold separately. 300-pound weight capacity.

INFLATION INSTRUCTIONS: It may be necessary to re-inflate the ball after initial inflation to allow the ball’s material to stretch to its final size. Inflate ball with air, let stand for 24 hours, deflate 50% then fill again to 52cm height.

ALTERNATIVE DESK CHAIR: Same ball and chair as our best-selling alternative desk chair created by leading health & fitness experts to improve back health and core strength, but without the back support bar, encouraging better posture throughout the day

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
